meanings.definition: The position or role of an editor.
meanings.sent1: Her editorship at the magazine required attention to detail.
meanings.sent2: The editorship of the newspaper changed hands last month.
meanings.sent3: In a surprising turn of events, the cat assumed the editorship of the book club.
meanings.sent4: The editorship of the team was like being the captain of a ship, guiding everyone towards success.
meanings.sent5: The editorship of the school newspaper was a badge of honor among students.

meanings.definition: The term of office or tenure of an editor.
meanings.sent1: His editorship lasted for five years before he retired.
meanings.sent2: The editorship of the magazine was filled by a talented journalist.
meanings.sent3: The editorship of the cookie jar was short-lived once the kids found it.
meanings.sent4: She held the editorship of the committee with grace and efficiency.
meanings.sent5: The editorship of the company brought new ideas and fresh perspectives to the table.
